title: Amanda_Knox
extract: Amanda Marie Knox is an American author, activist, and journalist. She spent almost four years incarcerated in Italy after her wrongful conviction in the 2007 murder of Meredith Kercher, a fellow exchange student, with whom she shared an apartment in Perugia. In 2015, Knox was definitively acquitted by the Italian Supreme Court of Cassation. In 2024, an Italian appellate court upheld Amanda Knox's slander conviction for falsely accusing Patrick Lumumba of murdering Meredith Kercher.
trending_reason: The Amanda Knox article might be trending on Wikipedia due to renewed public interest following the recent upholding of her slander conviction related to the Meredith Kercher case.

title: Charli_D'Amelio
extract: Charli Grace D'Amelio is an American social media personality and dancer. She was a competitive dancer for over a decade before starting her social media career in 2019, when she began posting dance videos on the video-sharing platform TikTok. She quickly amassed a large following and subsequently became the most-followed creator on the platform in March 2020 until she was surpassed by Khaby Lame in June 2022. With over 155 million followers, she is the second most-followed person on TikTok, as of 2025.
trending_reason: The Charli D'Amelio article might be trending on Wikipedia due to her recent Broadway debut in the musical "& Juliet," marking a significant expansion of her career beyond social media.

title: Patrick_Kluivert
extract: Patrick Stephan Kluivert is a Dutch football coach and former player who is currently serving as the head coach of the Indonesian national team. As a player, he played as a striker, most notably for Ajax, Barcelona and the Netherlands national team. He is considered one of the best Dutch strikers of all time.

'''Patrick Stephan Kluivert''' ({{IPA|nl|ˈpɛtrɪ ˈklœyvərt|-|Nl-Patrick Kluivert.ogg}}; born 1 July 1976) is a Dutch [[Association football|football]] [[coach (sport)|coach]] and [[Football player|former player]] who is currently serving as the head coach of the [[Indonesia national football team|Indonesian national team]]. As a player, he played as a [[Striker (association football)|striker]], most notably for [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]], [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] and the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands national team]].<ref name="Profile">{{cite web |title=Patrick Kluivert:Profile |url=http://www.eurosport.com/football/patrick-kluivert_prs262/person.shtml |website=Eurosport.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Patrick Kluivert: 'Als vader ben ik erg trots' |url=https://www.ajaxshowtime.com/article/108983/patrick-kluivert-als-vader-ben-ik-erg-trots |website=www.ajaxshowtime.com}}{{Dead link|date=April 2024|bot=InternetArchiveBot|fix-attempted=yes}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=5 December 2017 |title=Kluivert alaba a Valverde | Barça |url=https://www.mundodeportivo.com/futbol/fc-barcelona/20171205/433433026340/kluivert-alaba-a-valverde-ha-creado-un-bloque-muy-organizado.html |website=Mundo Deportivo}}</ref> He is considered one of the best Dutch strikers of all time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://voetbalstats.nl/|title=Ons Oranje stats|website=Voetbal.nl}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://thesefootballtimes.co/2016/03/06/patrick-kluivert-and-a-lesson-in-scoring-goals/|title=Patrick Kluivert and a lesson in scoring goals|date=21 February 2018 |publish
trending_reason: The Patrick Kluivert article might be trending on Wikipedia due to his recent appointment as head coach of the Indonesian national football team, marking a significant new chapter in his coaching career.

'''Justin Dean Kluivert''' (born 5 May 1999) is a Dutch professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] or [[forward (association football)|forward]] for {{English football updater|AFCBourn}} club [[AFC Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] and the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands national team]].

The son of former Dutch international football player [[Patrick Kluivert]], and grandson of former Surinamese football player [[Kenneth Kluivert]], Justin Kluivert began his career at [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]], coming through the youth system. After playing for two seasons with the Dutch side, in 2018 Kluivert moved to Italian side [[AS Roma|Roma]] for €18.75 million. He also represented the Netherlands internationally, first at youth level from 2013, before making his senior debut in 2018.

==Club career==
=== Ajax ===
Born in [[Amsterdam]], Kluivert came through the [[AFC Ajax]] youth program,<ref>{{cite news|title=Justin Kluivert (16) tekent contract bij Ajax|url=http://nos.nl/artikel/2102149-justin-kluivert-16-tekent-contract-bij-ajax.html|access-date=17 September 2016|work=nos.nl|date=29 April 2016|language=nl}}</ref> and had his first professional contract with [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ajax signs contract with Justin Kluivert|url=http://english.ajax.nl/article/-ajax-signs-contract-with-justin-kluivert-.htm|work=ajax.nl|access-date=1 July 2016|archive-date=2 July 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180702150737/http://english.ajax.nl/article/-ajax-signs-contract-with-justin-kluivert-.htm|url-status=dead}}</ref> He made his [[Eerste Divisie]] debut with [[Jong Ajax]] on 16 September 2016 in a game against [[MVV Maastricht|MVV]], replacing [[Vince Gino Dekker]] in the 67th minute, in a 1–0 away loss.<ref name="soccerway2">{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/09/16/netherlands/eerste-divisie/stichting-mvv/jong-ajax/2240625/|title=MVV Maastricht vs. Jong Ajax - 16 September 2016 |publisher=Soccerway|access-date=17 September 2016}}</ref> He also played in the [[2016–17 UEFA Youth League]], in which he scored in a 2–0 group stage win at [[PAOK Academy|PAOK]] on 2 November.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ajax A1 boekt overtuigende Youth League-zege bij PAOK |url=https://www.fcupdate.nl/voetbalnieuws/306727/ajax-a1-boekt-overtuigende-youth-league-zege-bij-paok/ |access-date=8 January 2019 |publisher=FC Update |date=2 November 2016}}</ref>

Kluivert made his first team debut in the [[Eredivisie]] on 15 January 2017 in a 1–3 away win against [[PEC Zwolle]], when he replaced [[Amin Younes]] in the 39th

title: Gaël_Monfils
extract: Gaël Sébastien Monfils is a French professional tennis player. He has been ranked as high as world No. 6 in singles by the ATP, which he achieved in November 2016. His career highlights include reaching two major semifinals at the 2008 French Open and 2016 US Open, and three ATP Masters 1000 finals – two at the Paris Masters in 2009 and 2010, and at the 2016 Monte-Carlo Masters. Monfils has won 13 ATP Tour singles titles, and has been runner-up 22 times.

[[Thierry Champion]] (2004–2006), [[Tarik Benhabiles]] (2007–2008), [[Roger Rasheed]] (2008–2011), Patrick Chamagne (2011–2013), Jan de Witt (2015), Liam Smith (2019–2020),
Richard Ruckelshausen (2021–2023), [[Günter Bresnik]] (2021–2023) | careerprizemoney = US $23,295,060{{Cite web|url=https://www.protennislive.com/posting/ramr/career_prize.pdf|title=ATP Prize Money title: Marti_Pellow
extract: Marti Pellow is a Scottish singer. He was the lead singer of the pop group Wet Wet Wet for 28 years: from their formation in 1982 until their split in 1997, and again from their reformation in 2004 to his departure in 2017. He has also recorded albums as a solo artist, and performed as an actor in musical theatre productions in both the West End and on Broadway.

title: Frodo_Baggins
extract: Frodo Baggins is a fictional character in J. R. R. Tolkien's writings and one of the protagonists in The Lord of the Rings. Frodo is a hobbit of the Shire who inherits the One Ring from his cousin Bilbo Baggins, described familiarly as "uncle", and undertakes the quest to destroy it in the fires of Mount Doom in Mordor. He is mentioned in Tolkien's posthumously published works, The Silmarillion and Unfinished Tales.
text:
{{Short description|Fictional hobbit protagonist in J. R. R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings}}
{{redirect|Frodo}}
{{good article}}
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2017}}
{{Infobox character
| name      = Frodo Baggins
| image     = <!--Please do not try to insert anything humorous here, you will only be blocked from editing--><!--NO FAN ART HERE, THANKS-->
| first     = ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]'' (1954)
| last      = ''[[Bilbo's Last Song]]'' (1974)
| aliases   = Mr. Underhill
| race      = [[Hobbit]]
| gender    = Male
| affiliation = [[Company of the Ring]]
| family    = [[Bilbo Baggins]] <!-- (cousin) --- Yes this is correct, please leave it alone: although Frodo referred to Bilbo as his "uncle", they were in fact first and second cousins, once removed either way (his paternal great-great-uncle's son's son and his maternal great-aunt's son; see the Baggins family tree (below) for how this was so. -->
| home = [[The Shire]]
}}
<!--
       NO FAN ART HERE, THANKS
-->
'''Frodo Baggins''' ([[Westron]]: ''Maura Labingi'') is a fictional character in [[J. R. R. Tolkien]]'s writings and one of the protagonists<!-- in LOTR he's DEFINITELY not the only one (see [[Heroism in The Lord of the Rings]] for some others), but everyone wants to call him a protagonist, see the history--> in ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''. Frodo is a [[hobbit]] of [[Shire (Middle-earth)|the Shire]] who inherits the [[One Ring]] from his cousin<!--"uncle" is just a friendly name, they are actually both first and second cousins--> [[Bilbo Baggins]], described familiarly as "uncle", and undertakes [[Quests in Middle-earth|the quest]] to destroy it in the fires of [[Mount Doom]] in [[Mordor]]. He is mentioned in Tolkien's posthumously published works, ''[[The Silmarillion]]'' and ''[[Unfinished Tales]]''.

Frodo is repeatedly wounded during the quest and becomes increasingly burdened by the Ring as it nears Mordor. He changes, too, growing in understanding and compassion, and avoiding violence. On his return to the Shire, he is unable to settle back into ordinary life; two years after the Ring's destruction, he is allowed to take ship to the [[earthly paradise]] of [[Valinor]].

Frodo's name comes from the [[Old English]] name ''[[Froda|Fróda]]'', meaning "wise by experience". Commentators have written that he combines courage, selflessness, and fidelity and that as a good<ref name="Stanton 223"/> character, he seems unexciting but grows through his quest, an [[Heroism in The Lord of the Rings|unheroic person who reaches heroic stature]].

==Internal history==
 	
[[File:Sketch Map of The Shire.svg|thumb|upright=2.25|Sketch map of [[the Shire]]. Frodo lived at [[Bag End]], in Hobbiton, near the centre of the map.]]

===Background===

Frodo is introduced in ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' as [[Bilbo Baggins]]'s cousin<!--no, not nephew, see the family tree below!-->{{efn|Although Frodo referred to Bilbo as his "uncle", they were in fact first ''and'' second cousins, once removed either way (his paternal great-great-uncle's son's son and his maternal great-aunt's son).}} and adoptive heir.<ref name="Party" group=T/> Frodo's parents, Drogo Baggins and Primula Brandybuck, had been killed in a boating accident when Frodo was twelve; Frodo spends the next nine years living with his maternal family, the Brandybucks, in Brandy Hall. At the age of twenty-one, he is adopted by Bilbo, who brings him to live at his home, [[Bag End]] in [[the Shire]]. He and Bilbo share the same birthday, the 22nd of September. Bilbo introduces Frodo to the [[Elvish languages (Middle-earth)|Elvish languages]], and they often go on long walking trips together.<ref name="Party" group=T>{{harvnb|Tolkien|1954a}} book 1, ch. 1, "A Long-Expected Party"</ref>

===''The Fellowship of the Ring''===

Frodo comes of age as Bilbo leaves the Shire. Frodo inherits Bag End and [[One Ring|Bilbo's ring]]. [[Gandalf]], uncertain about the origin of the ring, warns Frodo to avoid using it and to keep it secret.<ref name="Party" group=T/> Frodo keeps it hidden for the next seventeen years, and it gives him the same longevity it had given Bilbo. Gandalf [[The Shadow of the Past|returns to tell him]] that it is the One Ring of the Dark Lord [[Sauron]], who is seeking to recover and use it to conquer [[Middle-earth]].<ref group=T>{{harvnb|Tolkien|1954a}} book 1, ch. 2, "[[The Shadow of the Past]]"</ref>

Realising that he is a danger to the Shire as long as he remains there, Frodo decides to take the Ring to [[Rivendell]], home of [[Elrond]], a mighty [[Elf (Middle-earth)|Elf]]-lord. He leaves with three companions: his gardener [[Samwise Gamgee]] and his cousins [[Merry Brandybuck]] and [[Pippin Took]]. They are just in time, for Sauron's most powerful servants, the Nine [[Nazgûl]], have entered the Shire as Black Riders, looking for the Ring. They follow Frodo's trail, nearly intercepting him.<ref group=T>{{harvnb|Tolkien|1954a}} book 1, ch. 3, "Three is Company"</ref><ref group=T>{{harvnb|Tolki
trending_reason: The Frodo Baggins article might be trending on Wikipedia due to the resurgence of interest in J.R.R. Tolkien's works, fueled by recent adaptations and anniversaries related to "The Lord of the Rings."

title: C._J._Stroud
extract: Coleridge Bernard "C. J." Stroud IV is an American professional football quarterback for the Houston Texans of the National Football League (NFL). He played college football for the Ohio State Buckeyes, where he holds several school records, including most passing yards in a single game with 573, as well as being the first player to throw for six touchdowns three times. Stroud was a Heisman Trophy finalist in 2021 and 2022, and was subsequently selected by the Houston Texans second overall in the 2023 NFL draft. In his rookie season, he led the Texans to a division title and playoff victory en route to winning the Offensive Rookie of the Year Award.
text:
{{Short description|American football player (born 2001)}}
{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2024}}

'''Coleridge Bernard''' "'''C. J.'''" '''Stroud IV''' (born October 3, 2001) is an American professional [[American football|football]] [[quarterback]] for the [[Houston Texans]] of the [[National Football League]] (NFL). He played [[college football]] for the [[Ohio State Buckeyes football|Ohio State Buckeyes]], where he holds several school records, including most passing yards in a single game with 573, as well as being the first player to throw for six touchdowns three times. Stroud was a [[Heisman Trophy]] finalist in 2021 and 2022, and was subsequently selected by the Houston Texans [[List of second overall NFL draft picks|second overall]] in the [[2023 NFL draft]]. In his rookie season, he led the Texans to a division title and playoff victory en route to winning the [[National Football League Rookie of the Year Award|Offensive Rookie of the Year Award]].

==Early life==
Stroud was born on October 3, 2001, in [[Rancho Cucamonga, California]], the youngest of four children.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Husslein |first=Megan |date=October 4, 2022 |title=Happy Belated Birthday, C.J.! 21 things to love about Stroud |url=https://www.landgrantholyland.com/2022/10/4/23386563/happy-belated-birthday-c-j-21-things-to-love-about-stroud-ohio-state-buckeyes-football |access-date=October 17, 2022 |website=Land-Grant Holy Land |language=en}}</ref><ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Carpenter |first=Zack |date=February 8, 2020 |title="I've Been Through Hell and Back:" C.J. Stroud's Roller-Coaster Upbringing Taught Him How to "Scratch and Claw Through Life" |url=https://www.elevenwarriors.com/ohio-state-football/2020/02/112061/i-ve-been-through-hell-and-back-cj-strouds-life-has-been-a-roller-coaster-but-rough-experiences-growing-up-in |access-date=October 17, 2022 |website=Eleven Warriors |language=en}}</ref> In 2016, his father, Coleridge Bernard Stroud III, received a 38-years-to-life sentence after pleading guilty to kidnapping, carjacking and robbery in connection with a drug-related incident under California's [[three-strikes law]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=People v. Stroud |url=https://casetext.com/case/people-v-stroud-67 |access-date=August 11, 2023 |website=casetext.com |publisher=Casetext, Inc.}}</ref> As of 2023, his father has been incarcerated since Stroud was in middle school,<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web |last=Wasserman |first=Ari |date=November 14, 2019 |title=Ohio State QB target C.J. Stroud's past and what it can tell us about the future |url=https://theathletic.com/1378586/2019/11/14/cj-stroud-2020-quarterback-recruit/ |access-date=October 17, 2022 |website=The Athletic |language=en}}</ref> and is serving his sentence in [[Folsom State Prison]] near [[Sacramento]]. The incarceration sent the Stroud family into severe financial debt; they lived in a small apartment above a storage facility as Stroud entered [[Rancho Cucamonga High School]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Dellenger |first=Ross |date=December 30, 2022 |title=Family, Football and Forgiveness: C.J. Stroud's Road to the Playoff Was Anything but Easy |url=https://www.s
trending_reason: The C. J. Stroud article might be trending on Wikipedia due to his standout performance in the NFL, where he recently won the Offensive Rookie of the Year Award and led the Houston Texans to a division title and playoff victory.

title: Elina_Svitolina
extract: Elina Mykhailivna Svitolina is a Ukrainian professional tennis player. She reached career-high rankings of world No. 3 in singles and No. 108 in doubles by the WTA. Svitolina has won 17 WTA Tour singles titles, including the 2018 WTA Finals, and has reached three major singles semifinals.
text:
{{short description|Ukrainian tennis player (born 1994)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2024}}{{family name hatnote|Mykhailivna|Svitolina|lang=Eastern Slavic}} {{Infobox tennis biography |name = Elina Svitolina |native_name = {{lang|uk|Еліна Михайлівна Світоліна}} |image = Elina Svitolina (2023 DC Open) 28 (cropped).jpg |caption = Svitolina at the [[2023 Mubadala Citi DC Open|2023 Washington Open]] |country = {{UKR}} |residence = [[London]], England

Accessed 2 February 2024. *[[WTA Tour records#WTA career prize money leaders|17th in all-time rankings]] |website =[https://ukraine.elinasvitolinafoundation.org/en/ Elina Svitolina Foundation in Ukraine] |singlesrecord = {{tennis record|won=466|lost=247}} |singlestitles = 17 |highestsinglesranking = No. 3 (11 September 2017) |currentsinglesranking = No. 23 (11 November 2024) |AustralianOpenresult = QF ([[2018 Australian Open – Women's singles|2018]], [[2019 Australian Open – Women's singles|2019]], ''[[2025 Australian Open – Women's singles|2025]]'') |FrenchOpenresult = = SF ([[2019 Wimbledon Championships – Women's singles|2019]], [[2023 Wimbledon Championships – Women's singles|2023]]) |USOpenresult = SF ([[2019 US Open – Women's singles|2019]]) |Othertournaments = yes |WTAChampionshipsresult = '''W''' ([[2018 WTA Finals – Singles|2018]]) |Olympicsresult = Bronze ([[Tennis at the 2020 Summer Olympics – Women's singles|2021]]) |doublesrecord = {{tennis record|won=48|lost=68}} |doublestitles = 2 |highestdoublesranking = No. 108 (4 May 2015) |currentdoublesranking = |AustralianOpenDoublesresult = 1R ([[2014 Australian Open – Women's doubles|2014]], [[2016 Australian Open – Women's doubles|2016]]) |FrenchOpenDoublesresult = 2R ([[2014 French Open – Women's doubles|2014]]) |WimbledonDoublesresult = 2R ([[2016 Wimbledon Championships – Women's doubles|2016]]) |USOpenDoublesresult = 2R ([[2014 US Open – Women's doubles|2014]]) |OthertournamentsDoubles = yes |OlympicsDoublesresult = 1R ([[Tennis at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Women's doubles|2016]], [[Tennis at the 2020 Summer Olympics – Women's doubles|2021]]) |AustralianOpenMixedresult = SF ([[2017 Australian Open – Mixed doubles|2017]]) |FrenchOpenMixedresult = 2R ([[2015 French Open – Mixed doubles|2015]], [[2017 French Open – Mixed doubles|2017]]) |WimbledonMixedresult = 3R ([[2014 Wimbledon Championships – Mixed doubles|2014]]) |USOpenMixedresult = 2R ([[2018 US Open – Mixed doubles|2018]]) |Team = yes |FedCupresult = {{tennis record|won=15|lost=11}} |HopmanCupresult = F ([[2016 Hopman Cup|2016]]) |updated = 25 November 2024 |medaltemplates-expand = yes |medaltemplates = {{MedalCountry|{{UKR}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Tennis at the Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]]}} {{MedalBronze|[[2020 Summer Olympics|2020 Tokyo]]|[[Tennis at the 2020 Summer Olympics – Women's singles|Singles]]}} }} '''Elina Mykhailivna Svitolina''' ({{langx|uk|Еліна Михайлівна Світоліна}}, {{IPA|uk|ɛˈlʲinɑ̝ s⁽ʲ⁾vʲiˈtɔlʲinɑ̝|pron}};{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-nF3p4gF28o&t=574 |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211215/-nF3p4gF28o |archive-date=2021-12-15 |url-status=live|title=🎾Элина Свитолина про первый секс, 500$ в час, самолёт в подарок и ругань матом – YouTube|website=[[YouTube]] |date=2018-09-09|access-date=2020-09-20}}{{cbignore}}
{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0wNdIRHUxx0&t=18 |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211215/0wNdIRHUxx0 |archive-date=2021-12-15 |url-status=live|title=Ексклюзивне інтерв'ю з найуспішнішою тенісисткою Світоліною та її коханим – YouTube|website=[[YouTube]] |date=2019-09-21|access-date=2020-09-20}}{{cbignore}} born 12 September 1994) is a Ukrainian professional [[tennis]] player. She reached career-high rankings of world No. 3 in singles and No. 108 in doubles by the [[WTA rankings|WTA]]. Svit
trending_reason: The Elina Svitolina article might be trending on Wikipedia due to her recent performance at the 2025 Australian Open, where she reached the quarterfinals, showcasing her continued competitiveness on the WTA tour.

news.title: Husband-Wife Duo Of Gael Monfils, Elina Svitolina Knock Off No. 4 Seeds At Australian Open
news.snippet: It was a day of joyous success for the husband and wife duo of Gael Monfils and Elina Svitolina on Saturday at the Australian Open.

news.title: Elina Svitolina will be courtside for husband Gaël Monfils, hopes he joins her in Australian Open quarterfinals
news.snippet: With her match in the bag, Elina Svitolina can shift her focus back on husband Gaël Monfils, who is a win away from joining her in the Australian Open...

news.title: Svitolina rallies, faces Keys in Australian quarters
news.snippet: Elina Svitolina rallied from 4-1 down defeat Veronika Kudermetova 6-4, 6-1 to reach the Australian Open quarterfinals. Svitolina will face Madison Keys in...

news.title: Svitolina wants to give Ukraine a 'little light' after reaching quarter-finals
news.snippet: Ukraine's Elina Svitolina said she feels it is her responsibility to bring her country a "little light" after she charged past Russian Veronika Kudermetova...

news.title: Wife-and-husband duo Elina Svitolina and Gael Monfils win on the same court at the Australian Open
news.snippet: Gael Monfils has joined Roger Federer as the only men to reach the Australian Open's fourth round at age 38 or older since the tournament field expanded to...

news.title: Australian Open: Elina Svitolina rallies to reach the Australian Open quarterfinals for the third time
news.snippet: Elina Svitolina has rallied from two breaks down in the first set and taken 11 of the next 12 games in a 6-4, 6-1 victory over Veronika Kudermetova to reach...

news.title: Australian Open Day 9 Women's Predictions Including Veronika Kudermetova vs Elina Svitolina
news.snippet: Elina Svitolina battles Veronika Kudermetova in the round of 16 at the Australian Open, Emma Navarro and Iga Swiatek are also in action.

news.title: Keys, Svitolina to face off in AO 2025 quarterfinal
news.snippet: In their respective fourth round matches, Elina Svitolina beat Veronika Kurdermetova and Madison Keys dispatched 2023 finalist Elena Rybakina, to set up an...

news.title: Australian Open 2025 results: Elina Svitolina beats fourth seed Jasmine Paolini, Elena Rybakina through
news.snippet: Elina Svitolina says she was "inspired" by her husband Gael Monfils' performance before her win over Jasmine Paolini in the third round of the Australian...

news_relation:
Elina Svitolina is currently in the news for her success at the Australian Open, where she has advanced to the quarterfinals and is competing alongside her husband, Gael Monfils.
  • Husband-Wife Duo Of Gael Monfils, Elina Svitolina Knock Off No. 4 Seeds At Australian Open snippet: It was a day of joyous success for the husband and wife duo of Gael Monfils and Elina Svitolina on Saturday at the Australian Open.
  • Svitolina rallies, faces Keys in Australian quarters snippet: Elina Svitolina rallied from 4-1 down to defeat Veronika Kudermetova 6-4, 6-1 to reach the Australian Open quarterfinals.
  • Svitolina wants to give Ukraine a 'little light' after reaching quarter-finals snippet: Elina Svitolina said she feels it is her responsibility to bring her country a "little light" after her victory at the Australian Open.
